Text.Language: The prophecies of the Third Hour of the eve of Tuesday of Holy Pascha. May its blessings be with us. Amen.

Pl/mma m~p~caji m~P[oic e~jen p~Icra/l qen t~jij m~pefaggeloc: ,ac e~jen petenh/t: aimenre y/nou peje P[oic ouoh pejwten je qen ou akmenriten:
The burden of the word of the Lord to Israel by the hand of His messenger Malachi. Take it to heart! "I have loved you," says the Lord. "But you say, 'In what way have You loved us?'

M/ ne p~con an n~Iakwb pe /~cau peje P[oic: ouoh Iakwb aimenritf: ouoh /~cau aimectwf: ouoh aiyws n~nef[ii~ eutako: ouoh tefk~l/ronomia~ n~te hantoi n~te p~safe:

Was not Esau the brother of Jacob?" says the Lord. "Yet Jacob I have loved, but Esau I have hated, and I have appointed his borders for destruction and made his heritage as dwellings of the wilderness."

Because one will say, "Edom has been destroyed, but let us return and rebuild the desolate places,"

Thus says the Lord, Ruler of all: "They may build, but I will throw down.

They shall be called the Territory of Wickedness, and the people against whom the Lord has placed Himself forever.

Your eyes will see, and you will say, 'The Lord is magnified beyond the borders of Israel.'

"A son honors his father, and a servant his master. If then, I am the Father, where is My honor? And if I am a Master, where is the reverence due to me?" says the Lord Almighty.

"You priests are the ones who disparage My name, yet you say, 'In what way have we disparaged Your name?'

And when you offer the blind as a sacrifice, is that not evil?

And when you offer the lame and sick, is that not evil? Offer it then to your ruler! See if he will accept it, if he will accept it favorably," says the Lord Almighty.

Look upon me and hear me, O Lord my God; enlighten my eyes, lest I sleep in death,

But I hope in Your mercy; my heart shall greatly rejoice in Your salvation. Alleluia.

On this day some people came and told Him that king Herod wants to kill him saying, â€œTeacher, get out of here and leave this area because this irreverent Herod wants to kill you.â€?

O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the one who kills the prophets and stones those that are sent to you; how often I wanted to gather your children together and you were not willing. Behold your house will be desolate forever.
